Key Match Events: The Kings led the Warriors by 15 points at the end of the first quarter, and took as much as a 39-point lead before winning 129-99.
Steph Curry scored 26 points on 8-12 shooting, but it was his first game since March 2018 with zero assists.
The Warriors turned the ball over 22 times in Sunday's loss.
Pre-Game Insights: Heading into a home matchup against a Sacramento Kings squad playing without All-Star point guard De'Aaron Fox, the Golden State Warriors were expected to win handily.
Post-Match Reflections: Following the loss, Curry was very honest about how this Warriors squad is not built to come back from large deficits.

Curry said, 'When you're looking up and it's a double-digit lead before the first timeout and 36-21, we're not really built for it to have that crazy comeback. We haven't shown [the ability to come back], and it's just one of those things where you don't want to be in that situation, especially in a back-to-back... We would have loved to have started the game a lot better to give ourselves a chance.'
